name: 英文（三）：藝術英文
restrict: ◎必須先修過【英文(一)】◎必須先修過【英文(二)】
description: 藉由閱讀及討論藝術相關主題之應文文章及多媒體素材強化學生英語溝通表達能力，以戀期藝術專業英語之知能及信心。
goals: 1. 增進學生英語溝通表達能力 2. 透過參與課程活動促進團隊精神 3. 透過多面向英語閱讀促使學生了解多元文化，拓展學生國際化視野 4. 透過課堂討論培養批判精神 5. 提升學生英語學習動機及自主學習興趣
syllabus:
**Freshman English for Non-English Majors (English for Arts, Spring 2019)**

**13:20~15:10, Friday at Jang 103**

Instructor: Hsu Hsiao-Ling
--------------------------

Email: [hlhsu@ntnu.edu.tw](mailto:hlhsu@ntnu.edu.tw)
----------------------------------------------------

Office: Common Core Education Committee, 3rd floor of Administrative Building

Office Hours: By appointment

**Course Description:**

Art is not just for artists and the professionals. This course will focus on how to develop aesthetics in daily life and learn to create art with easy-to-follow steps. The instructor will introduce multiple forms of arts, including graffiti, photography, calligraphy, Zentangle®, and even theater and ballet. The students will learn to use English to describe their own creative projects and those of others.

**Grading Policy:**

Attendance

25%

45%

**Attendance and Participation (individual work)**

\-Punctual attendance and active participation are required. If you are habitually late or absent, points will be deducted and you may fail this course. If you have to miss a class, please inform me in advance. Participation also includes teamwork and group projects. 

**Photowalking**

\-Students are assigned to find out their walking path and take photos every 30 seconds, or take photo when you have something to share/tell on Oct. 5. (No class on that day)

        -Give a title to your Photowalking.

\-Students will be prepared to present one’s Photowalking and describe it in English for about 5 mins.

\-All of the photos should be put into a series of document, like PPT (no descriptive words in the PPT). Upload the file to the Moodle on Oct. 6.

\-Your introduction will be based on your pictures.

\-Evaluation will be based on the quality of your description, including meaningful content and language.

\-Extra points will be given to students who are elected to be good work.

**Critic project**

        -Based on the lectures, you will learn how to judge a work.

        -You and your partner will decide on a piece of work and judge it in front of class.

\-Critic presentation should use no more than 15 min. PPT or any other form of presentation style are welcome.

\-Evaluation will be based on your quality of presentation, including using the words and sentence patterns introduced in class.
